subject: Re: [junit] RE: Abuse - Inappropriate Material - junit@yahoogroups.com  (KMM54613869V93979L0KM)
msgSnippet: ... I suspect David is right. In my experience with Yahoo, they are very good about nailing inappropriate use. After all, inappropriate advertising is lost
messageBody:
--- David Corbin <dcorbin@...> wrote:
> I suspect that the people (system?) at Yahoo responding to you failed
> to understand you, just like Mr. Rainsberger did.
> >I guess you missed my point... I'm not talking about the annoying
> > Yahoo ads appearing at the end of messages, I'm talking about REAL
> > SPAMMING,

I suspect David is right. In my experience with Yahoo, they are very
good about nailing inappropriate use. After all, inappropriate
advertising is lost revenue to them (that advertiser should have paid
for the privilege). Unfortunately, the visibility of mailing lists at
Yahoo seems to have increased the level of spamming greatly (egroups
wasn't as bad). I've started making the lists I administer restricted
so the list moderator has to approve new subscriptions. More work for
the moderator, but workable for lower subscription groups. It might be
too much work for the moderator of this group though.

Regards,

Rob
